Detailed Description

This class provides a general way to store and retrieve properties in a key-value structure. This class uses an hash table (thread safe version) and provides methods to store and retrieve integers, strings, doubles and objects. Integers, strings and doubles are stored by value, whereas objects are stored as pointers.

Constructor.

Definition at line 163 of file configtable.cpp.

uStreamLib::ConfigTable::~ConfigTable (  void   )  [virtual]
 

Destructor. Strings are stored in this table, so this method will deallocate all used memory. Objects are stored as pointers. All callbacks will be deleted by this method by default.

Definition at line 573 of file configtable.cpp.

Property * uStreamLib::ConfigTable::createPropertyDescription (  char *  key,
uint32  allowed_size = 255
) 
 

Create extended property descriptor. This method allows to setup a complex property description for the specified property key. A property description is an object in which to store extended info for gui interaction and for registering configtables into ConfigStorage objects. Key must exist to add an extended property description.

Parameters:
key the property key to use.
allowed_size maximum size of an element in the allowed values vector (default = 255).
Returns:
a pointer to the property description or NULL if it cannot be created.

PropertyGroup * uStreamLib::ConfigTable::createPropertyGroup (  char *  name  ) 
 

Create a property group. This method creates a group of properties that logically binds properties together.

Parameters:
gname property group name.
Returns:
a pointer to the created group or NULL if an error occurs.

double *  value
)

Definition at line 482 of file configtable.hpp.

virtual char* uStreamLib::ConfigTable::getStorageFilename (  void   )  [inline, virtual]
 

Implement this method in subclasses if you want this config table be correctly managed by ConfigStorage objects. This method must return a valid filename. Please, don't provide a path but only a filename since ConfigTable provides the full path.

Definition at line 631 of file configtable.hpp.

int32 uStreamLib::ConfigTable::init (  uint32  hash_size  ) 
 

Create a Configuration Parameters Table. Parameters are stored into an hash table in the form of key,value pairs. Each parameter can have a type: TYPE_INT, TYPE_DOUBLE, TYPE_STRING or TYPE_OBJECT.

Parameters:
hash_size the number of buckets in the hash table.

int32 uStreamLib::ConfigTable::setDouble (  char *  key,
double  value
) 
 

Register and set the specified key. Its value is a double. Use this method to register the parameter for the first time. Callbacks will be invoked on this write operation.

Parameters:
key he key to register.
value the value to store.
Returns:
SUCCESS or FAILURE.

Definition at line 613 of file configtable.cpp.

int32 uStreamLib::ConfigTable::setNull (  char *  key  ) 
 

Set a property to the database like null value. If a property is set to null, then a getInt(), getString(), getDouble() and getObject() on it will return FAILURE. A call to setInt(), setString(), setDouble() and setObject() on it will make the property visible again.

Definition at line 597 of file configtable.cpp.

void *  object,
uint16  otype_id
) 
 

Register and set the specified key. Its value is an object. Use this method to register the parameter for the first time. Callbacks will be invoked on this write operation.

Parameters:
key he key to register.
value the value to store (only the pointer is stored).
otype_id custom object type identifier.
Returns:
SUCCESS or FAILURE.
